citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The written search for alternatives did not include the potentially painful procedure performed on protocol 6236. The
written search assures the IACUC that the investigator has considered alternatives to this procedure. The facility must
ensure that the investigator provides written documentation they have considered alternatives to the procedure. Correct
by 24NOV2024.

The wire fencing for the enclosure for horses is in disrepair. Multiple areas of fencing are rusted and disintegrating with
broken wire sticking out where the horses have access. Sharp points may potentially cause injury. The indoor and outdoor
housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and
to contain the animals.
Corrected during the day of inspection on 24OCT2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
SARA TOBIAS, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.31(d)(1)(ii) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
The written search for alternatives did not include the potentially painful procedure performed on protocol 6236. The 
written search assures the IACUC that the investigator has considered alternatives to this procedure. The facility must 
ensure that the investigator provides written documentation they have considered alternatives to the procedure. Correct 
by 24NOV2024. 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The wire fencing for the enclosure for horses is in disrepair. Multiple areas of fencing are rusted and disintegrating with 
broken wire sticking out where the horses have access. Sharp points may potentially cause injury. The indoor and outdoor 
housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and 
to contain the animals. 
Corrected during the day of inspection on 24OCT2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
SARA TOBIAS, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
